titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jacob Ranft title abstract 1978.007
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:17:58 +0000.

did.abstract: A title abstract for a piece of property purchased by Jacob Ranft and his wife, Margaret, and located on the Southern side of Norman and Cypress Streets in Queens, New York. Dates found within the abstract range from 1843 to 1907. This property was originally part of a land tract owned by Nicholas N. Wycoff. The title gives a description of how the land was originally partioned after Wycoff's death on July 2, 1843. The property was bought by the Ranft Family in 1907.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Jacob Ranft title abstract, 1978.007, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
